channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go assures fire victims of aid despite ECQ
item.description: Even without his physical presence due to the restrictions of the enhanced community quarantine in Luzon, Sen. Bong Go has assured the people that his office will continue to provide relief assistance to fire victims anywhere in the country amid the coronavirus disease 2019 outbreak.

item.title: Metro heat index hits 42 ºC
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: The heat index the temperature as felt by the human body in Metro Manila hit 42 degrees Celsius on Wednesday.

item.title: 400,000 OFWs seen to lose jobs to COVID
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: A research paper by Ateneo de Manila University projected recently that about 300,000 to 400,000 overseas Filipino workers could be affected by layoffs and salary cuts due to the expected shutdown of offices abroad brought about by the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: Philippines files 2 diplomatic protests vs China
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: With the military being asked to join the police in enforcing enhanced community quarantine regulations, an official of the Department of Justice yesterday reiterated that there is basis to apprehend violators during the lockdown period.

item.title: Duterte yet to weigh POGO ops resumption
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has yet to assess the circumstances that might arise if the government allows the resumption of Chinese-owned Philippine offshore gaming operators while there is a review of the enhanced community quarantine imposed in Luzon until April 30.

item.title: House panel proposes P613 billion economic recovery stimulus
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: A House panel has proposed a P613-billion stimulus measure to help the government address the economic impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis.

item.title: Red Cross opens COVID testing lab in Mandaluyong
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: The Philippine Red Cross can now test 10,000 to 12,000 persons under investigation and monitoring for coronavirus disease 2019 with the opening on Tuesday of a state-of-the-art molecular testing laboratory in Mandaluyong City.

item.title: CHED hits proposal to suspend classes until December
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: It is irresponsible at this point to recommend a nationwide suspension of classes until December due to the coronavirus disease, according to the Commission on Higher Education.

item.title: COVID curve ‘almost plateaued’ but not yet flattened
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Health Secretary Francisco Duque III is hopeful that the country would be able to flatten the curve of coronavirus disease 2019 as the increase of cases has started to taper.

item.title: Congress to focus on COVID laws
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Congress will temporarily shelve pending bills and focus on legislation to help the country address the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis when lawmakers resume session on May 4, Senate Majority Leader Juan Miguel Zubiri said.
